meanings.definition: To eat (food or prey) hungrily or quickly.
meanings.sent1: The hungry child devoured the pizza in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The lion devoured its prey in a few swift bites.
meanings.sent3: The puppy devoured its food so fast, it seemed like a magic trick!
meanings.sent4: Time devoured the memories like a ravenous beast.
meanings.sent5: She devoured the book, unable to put it down until the last page.

meanings.sent1: The flames devoured the old wooden house in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The termites devoured the wooden beams, causing the structure to collapse.
meanings.sent3: The toddler devoured the tower of blocks with a mischievous grin.
meanings.sent4: Grief devoured her heart, leaving only emptiness behind.
meanings.sent5: The storm devoured the coastline, erasing familiar landmarks.

meanings.sent1: She devoured every episode of her favorite TV show in one weekend.
meanings.sent2: The art enthusiast devoured the museum's new exhibit with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: He devoured the ice cream cone with pure delight, savoring every bite.
meanings.sent4: The music lover devoured the concert, feeling every note deep in their soul.
meanings.sent5: The traveler devoured the breathtaking view from the mountaintop, feeling truly alive.
